ParentCompanyName: Southern Food Group L.P. dba Foremost Dairy

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Foremost Dairy believes in providing quality to our customers while maintaining the highest level of safety possible for our employees and the community we serve.  This commitment to safety is exercised daily.  Personnel from every department take active roles in quality assurance, accident prevention, training and community involvement.  To this end, the facility maintains a standing Safety Committee that meets regularly to address safety concerns and formulate solutions.

Foremost Dairy is also involved in an ongoing effort to comply with regulations at the local, state and federal levels that require accident prevention, planning, training, and response.  This informational brochure has been prepared to address some of these requirements.

Applicable Regulations
The Process Safety Management Program and Risk Management Plan at Foremost Dairy comply with 29 CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals, and 40 CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention: Risk Management Plan.

Facility Location and Regulated Substances
The Foremost Dairy facility located at 5415 Interstate Drive, Shreveport, Louisiana is equipped with a refrigeration system that contains anhydrous ammonia (C.A.S. #7664-41-7). Ammonia is the sole regulated substance in regard to the aforementioned regulations.  The maximum quantity of ammonia in the system exceeds 10,000 pounds.

Accident Release Prevention
Releases are prevented by a combination of engineering and administrative controls.  Administrative controls involve manual isolation and shutdown procedures to be performed by trained personnel.  The system is also equipped with pressure relief valves that operate to prevent damage to system components should pressures reach unsafe levels.  Operation of pressure relief valves will result in a controlled release of refrigerant.

5 Year Accident History
The facility has not experienced any reportable accidents in the past five (5) years.  Incidental releases may occur durin

g rountine engineering activities.  

Emergency Response Program and Policies
Written emergency procedures are maintained at the facility.  All employees are trained to act based on their pre-assigned roles during emergency situations.  Foremost Dairy has an agreement with a third party response contractor to be notified in the event of an uncontrolled release.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Planned changes to improve safety include the ongoing preventative maintenance program, and regular replacement of deteriorated system components.  In all cases, improved process technology is employed where feasible.  Employees levels of awareness is enhanced by regular training programs and exercises.
